intro: Seseli carvi, commonly known as caraway, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. The plant features slender, hollow stems and feathery, aromatic leaves. Its small white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The seeds, often referred to as caraway seeds, are widely used in culinary and medicinal applications.
